subject: Education
title: Education for the Economy: Human Capital Theory
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Education for the Economy: Human Capital Theory.

hook.text: Governments invest in education like they invest in infrastructureâ€”because it makes workers more productive.

buildup.text: Gary Becker's human capital theory treats education as an investment with economic returns.

discovery.text: Each year of schooling increases lifetime earnings by roughly 8-13% on average.

twist.text: Critics argue this reduces learners to economic units and ignores education's civic and personal value.

climax.text: When education is only about jobs, subjects without clear career paths get defunded first.

punchline.text: If you only measure education in dollars, you miss its most valuable returns.

quiz.question: What is the main criticism of human capital theory?
options: It reduces education's purpose to economic productivity, ignoring civic and personal growth
It overestimates the cost of education
It only applies to STEM fields
